096/** 
097 * Provides access to configuration parameters.
098 *
099 * <h4 id="Resources">Resources</h4>
100 *
101 * <p>Configurations are specified by resources. A resource contains a set of
102 * name/value pairs as XML data. Each resource is named by either a 
103 * <code>String</code> or by a {@link Path}. If named by a <code>String</code>, 
104 * then the classpath is examined for a file with that name.  If named by a 
105 * <code>Path</code>, then the local filesystem is examined directly, without 
106 * referring to the classpath.
107 *
108 * <p>Unless explicitly turned off, Hadoop by default specifies two 
109 * resources, loaded in-order from the classpath: <ol>
110 * <li><tt><a href="{@docRoot}/../core-default.html">core-default.xml</a>
111 * </tt>: Read-only defaults for hadoop.</li>
112 * <li><tt>core-site.xml</tt>: Site-specific configuration for a given hadoop
113 * installation.</li>
114 * </ol>
115 * Applications may add additional resources, which are loaded
116 * subsequent to these resources in the order they are added.
117 * 
118 * <h4 id="FinalParams">Final Parameters</h4>
119 *
120 * <p>Configuration parameters may be declared <i>final</i>. 
121 * Once a resource declares a value final, no subsequently-loaded 
122 * resource can alter that value.  
123 * For example, one might define a final parameter with:
124 * <tt><pre>
125 *  &lt;property&gt;
126 *    &lt;name&gt;dfs.hosts.include&lt;/name&gt;
127 *    &lt;value&gt;/etc/hadoop/conf/hosts.include&lt;/value&gt;
128 *    <b>&lt;final&gt;true&lt;/final&gt;</b>
129 *  &lt;/property&gt;</pre></tt>
130 *
131 * Administrators typically define parameters as final in 
132 * <tt>core-site.xml</tt> for values that user applications may not alter.
133 *
134 * <h4 id="VariableExpansion">Variable Expansion</h4>
135 *
136 * <p>Value strings are first processed for <i>variable expansion</i>. The
137 * available properties are:<ol>
138 * <li>Other properties defined in this Configuration; and, if a name is
139 * undefined here,</li>
140 * <li>Properties in {@link System#getProperties()}.</li>
141 * </ol>
142 *
143 * <p>For example, if a configuration resource contains the following property
144 * definitions: 
145 * <tt><pre>
146 *  &lt;property&gt;
147 *    &lt;name&gt;basedir&lt;/name&gt;
148 *    &lt;value&gt;/user/${<i>user.name</i>}&lt;/value&gt;
149 *  &lt;/property&gt;
150 *  
151 *  &lt;property&gt;
152 *    &lt;name&gt;tempdir&lt;/name&gt;
153 *    &lt;value&gt;${<i>basedir</i>}/tmp&lt;/value&gt;
154 *  &lt;/property&gt;</pre></tt>
155 *
156 * When <tt>conf.get("tempdir")</tt> is called, then <tt>${<i>basedir</i>}</tt>
157 * will be resolved to another property in this Configuration, while
158 * <tt>${<i>user.name</i>}</tt> would then ordinarily be resolved to the value
159 * of the System property with that name.
160 * By default, warnings will be given to any deprecated configuration 
161 * parameters and these are suppressible by configuring
162 * <tt>log4j.logger.org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration.deprecation</tt> in
163 * log4j.properties file.
164 */
165@InterfaceAudience.Public
166@InterfaceStability.Stable

251  /**
252   * Class to keep the information about the keys which replace the deprecated
253   * ones.
254   * 
255   * This class stores the new keys which replace the deprecated keys and also
256   * gives a provision to have a custom message for each of the deprecated key
257   * that is being replaced. It also provides method to get the appropriate
258   * warning message which can be logged whenever the deprecated key is used.
259   */
260  private static class DeprecatedKeyInfo {
261    private final String[] newKeys;
262    private final String customMessage;
263    private final AtomicBoolean accessed = new AtomicBoolean(false);
264
265    DeprecatedKeyInfo(String[] newKeys, String customMessage) {
266      this.newKeys = newKeys;
267      this.customMessage = customMessage;
268    }
269
270    /**
271     * Method to provide the warning message. It gives the custom message if
272     * non-null, and default message otherwise.
273     * @param key the associated deprecated key.
274     * @return message that is to be logged when a deprecated key is used.
275     */
276    private final String getWarningMessage(String key) {
277      String warningMessage;
278      if(customMessage == null) {
279        StringBuilder message = new StringBuilder(key);
280        String deprecatedKeySuffix = " is deprecated. Instead, use ";
281        message.append(deprecatedKeySuffix);
282        for (int i = 0; i < newKeys.length; i++) {
283          message.append(newKeys[i]);
284          if(i != newKeys.length-1) {
285            message.append(", ");
286          }
287        }
288        warningMessage = message.toString();
289      }
290      else {
291        warningMessage = customMessage;
292      }
293      return warningMessage;
294    }
295
296    boolean getAndSetAccessed() {
297      return accessed.getAndSet(true);
298    }
299
300    public void clearAccessed() {
301      accessed.set(false);
302    }
303  }
304  
305  /**
306   * A pending addition to the global set of deprecated keys.
307   */
308  public static class DeprecationDelta {
309    private final String key;
310    private final String[] newKeys;
311    private final String customMessage;
312
313    DeprecationDelta(String key, String[] newKeys, String customMessage) {
314      Preconditions.checkNotNull(key);
315      Preconditions.checkNotNull(newKeys);
316      Preconditions.checkArgument(newKeys.length > 0);
317      this.key = key;
318      this.newKeys = newKeys;
319      this.customMessage = customMessage;
320    }
321
322    public DeprecationDelta(String key, String newKey, String customMessage) {
323      this(key, new String[] { newKey }, customMessage);
324    }
325
326    public DeprecationDelta(String key, String newKey) {
327      this(key, new String[] { newKey }, null);
328    }
329
330    public String getKey() {
331      return key;
332    }
333
334    public String[] getNewKeys() {
335      return newKeys;
336    }
337
338    public String getCustomMessage() {
339      return customMessage;
340    }
341  }
342
343  /**
344   * The set of all keys which are deprecated.
345   *
346   * DeprecationContext objects are immutable.
347   */
348  private static class DeprecationContext {
349    /**
350     * Stores the deprecated keys, the new keys which replace the deprecated keys
351     * and custom message(if any provided).
352     */
353    private final Map<String, DeprecatedKeyInfo> deprecatedKeyMap;
354
355    /**
356     * Stores a mapping from superseding keys to the keys which they deprecate.
357     */
358    private final Map<String, String> reverseDeprecatedKeyMap;
359
360    /**
361     * Create a new DeprecationContext by copying a previous DeprecationContext
362     * and adding some deltas.
363     *
364     * @param other   The previous deprecation context to copy, or null to start
365     *                from nothing.
366     * @param deltas  The deltas to apply.
367     */
368    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
369    DeprecationContext(DeprecationContext other, DeprecationDelta[] deltas) {
370      HashMap<String, DeprecatedKeyInfo> newDeprecatedKeyMap = 
371        new HashMap<String, DeprecatedKeyInfo>();
372      HashMap<String, String> newReverseDeprecatedKeyMap =
373        new HashMap<String, String>();
374      if (other != null) {
375        for (Entry<String, DeprecatedKeyInfo> entry :
376            other.deprecatedKeyMap.entrySet()) {
377          newDeprecatedKeyMap.put(entry.getKey(), entry.getValue());
378        }
379        for (Entry<String, String> entry :
380            other.reverseDeprecatedKeyMap.entrySet()) {
381          newReverseDeprecatedKeyMap.put(entry.getKey(), entry.getValue());
382        }
383      }
384      for (DeprecationDelta delta : deltas) {
385        if (!newDeprecatedKeyMap.containsKey(delta.getKey())) {
386          DeprecatedKeyInfo newKeyInfo =
387            new DeprecatedKeyInfo(delta.getNewKeys(), delta.getCustomMessage());
388          newDeprecatedKeyMap.put(delta.key, newKeyInfo);
389          for (String newKey : delta.getNewKeys()) {
390            newReverseDeprecatedKeyMap.put(newKey, delta.key);
391          }
392        }
393      }
394      this.deprecatedKeyMap =
395        UnmodifiableMap.decorate(newDeprecatedKeyMap);
396      this.reverseDeprecatedKeyMap =
397        UnmodifiableMap.decorate(newReverseDeprecatedKeyMap);
398    }
399
400    Map<String, DeprecatedKeyInfo> getDeprecatedKeyMap() {
401      return deprecatedKeyMap;
402    }
403
404    Map<String, String> getReverseDeprecatedKeyMap() {
405      return reverseDeprecatedKeyMap;
406    }
407  }

433      new AtomicReference<DeprecationContext>(
434          new DeprecationContext(null, defaultDeprecations));

436  /**
437   * Adds a set of deprecated keys to the global deprecations.
438   *
439   * This method is lockless.  It works by means of creating a new
440   * DeprecationContext based on the old one, and then atomically swapping in
441   * the new context.  If someone else updated the context in between us reading
442   * the old context and swapping in the new one, we try again until we win the
443   * race.
444   *
445   * @param deltas   The deprecations to add.
446   */
447  public static void addDeprecations(DeprecationDelta[] deltas) {
448    DeprecationContext prev, next;
449    do {
450      prev = deprecationContext.get();
451      next = new DeprecationContext(prev, deltas);
452    } while (!deprecationContext.compareAndSet(prev, next));
453  }

455  /**
456   * Adds the deprecated key to the global deprecation map.
457   * It does not override any existing entries in the deprecation map.
458   * This is to be used only by the developers in order to add deprecation of
459   * keys, and attempts to call this method after loading resources once,
460   * would lead to <tt>UnsupportedOperationException</tt>
461   * 
462   * If a key is deprecated in favor of multiple keys, they are all treated as 
463   * aliases of each other, and setting any one of them resets all the others 
464   * to the new value.
465   *
466   * If you have multiple deprecation entries to add, it is more efficient to
467   * use #addDeprecations(DeprecationDelta[] deltas) instead.
468   * 
469   * @param key
470   * @param newKeys
471   * @param customMessage
472   * @deprecated use {@link #addDeprecation(String key, String newKey,
473      String customMessage)} instead
474   */
475  @Deprecated
476  public static void addDeprecation(String key, String[] newKeys,
477      String customMessage) {
478    addDeprecations(new DeprecationDelta[] {
479      new DeprecationDelta(key, newKeys, customMessage)
480    });
481  }

544  /**
545   * checks whether the given <code>key</code> is deprecated.
546   * 
547   * @param key the parameter which is to be checked for deprecation
548   * @return <code>true</code> if the key is deprecated and 
549   *         <code>false</code> otherwise.
550   */
551  public static boolean isDeprecated(String key) {
552    return deprecationContext.get().getDeprecatedKeyMap().containsKey(key);
553  }
554
555  /**
556   * Returns the alternate name for a key if the property name is deprecated
557   * or if deprecates a property name.
558   *
559   * @param name property name.
560   * @return alternate name.
561   */
562  private String[] getAlternateNames(String name) {
563    String altNames[] = null;
564    DeprecationContext cur = deprecationContext.get();
565    DeprecatedKeyInfo keyInfo = cur.getDeprecatedKeyMap().get(name);
566    if (keyInfo == null) {
567      altNames = (cur.getReverseDeprecatedKeyMap().get(name) != null ) ? 
568        new String [] {cur.getReverseDeprecatedKeyMap().get(name)} : null;
569      if(altNames != null && altNames.length > 0) {
570        //To help look for other new configs for this deprecated config
571        keyInfo = cur.getDeprecatedKeyMap().get(altNames[0]);
572      }      
573    } 
574    if(keyInfo != null && keyInfo.newKeys.length > 0) {
575      List<String> list = new ArrayList<String>(); 
576      if(altNames != null) {
577          list.addAll(Arrays.asList(altNames));
578      }
579      list.addAll(Arrays.asList(keyInfo.newKeys));
580      altNames = list.toArray(new String[list.size()]);
581    }
582    return altNames;
583  }
584
585  /**
586   * Checks for the presence of the property <code>name</code> in the
587   * deprecation map. Returns the first of the list of new keys if present
588   * in the deprecation map or the <code>name</code> itself. If the property
589   * is not presently set but the property map contains an entry for the
590   * deprecated key, the value of the deprecated key is set as the value for
591   * the provided property name.
592   *
593   * @param name the property name
594   * @return the first property in the list of properties mapping
595   *         the <code>name</code> or the <code>name</code> itself.
596   */
597  private String[] handleDeprecation(DeprecationContext deprecations,
598      String name) {
599    ArrayList<String > names = new ArrayList<String>();
600        if (isDeprecated(name)) {
601      DeprecatedKeyInfo keyInfo = deprecations.getDeprecatedKeyMap().get(name);
602      warnOnceIfDeprecated(deprecations, name);
603      for (String newKey : keyInfo.newKeys) {
604        if(newKey != null) {
605          names.add(newKey);
606        }
607      }
608    }
609    if(names.size() == 0) {
610        names.add(name);
611    }
612    for(String n : names) {
613          String deprecatedKey = deprecations.getReverseDeprecatedKeyMap().get(n);
614          if (deprecatedKey != null && !getOverlay().containsKey(n) &&
615              getOverlay().containsKey(deprecatedKey)) {
616            getProps().setProperty(n, getOverlay().getProperty(deprecatedKey));
617            getOverlay().setProperty(n, getOverlay().getProperty(deprecatedKey));
618          }
619    }
620    return names.toArray(new String[names.size()]);
621  }
622 
623  private void handleDeprecation() {
624    LOG.debug("Handling deprecation for all properties in config...");
625    DeprecationContext deprecations = deprecationContext.get();
626    Set<Object> keys = new HashSet<Object>();
627    keys.addAll(getProps().keySet());
628    for (Object item: keys) {
629      LOG.debug("Handling deprecation for " + (String)item);
630      handleDeprecation(deprecations, (String)item);
631    }
632  }

634  static{
635    //print deprecation warning if hadoop-site.xml is found in classpath
636    ClassLoader cL = Thread.currentThread().getContextClassLoader();
637    if (cL == null) {
638      cL = Configuration.class.getClassLoader();
639    }
640    if(cL.getResource("hadoop-site.xml")!=null) {
641      LOG.warn("DEPRECATED: hadoop-site.xml found in the classpath. " +
642          "Usage of hadoop-site.xml is deprecated. Instead use core-site.xml, "
643          + "mapred-site.xml and hdfs-site.xml to override properties of " +
644          "core-default.xml, mapred-default.xml and hdfs-default.xml " +
645          "respectively");
646    }
647    addDefaultResource("core-default.xml");
648    addDefaultResource("core-site.xml");
649  }

666  /** A new configuration where the behavior of reading from the default 
667   * resources can be turned off.
668   * 
669   * If the parameter {@code loadDefaults} is false, the new instance
670   * will not load resources from the default files. 
671   * @param loadDefaults specifies whether to load from the default files
672   */
673  public Configuration(boolean loadDefaults) {
674    this.loadDefaults = loadDefaults;
675    updatingResource = new HashMap<String, String[]>();
676    synchronized(Configuration.class) {
677      REGISTRY.put(this, null);
678    }
679  }
680  
681  /** 
682   * A new configuration with the same settings cloned from another.
683   * 
684   * @param other the configuration from which to clone settings.
685   */
686  @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
687  public Configuration(Configuration other) {
688   this.resources = (ArrayList<Resource>) other.resources.clone();
689   synchronized(other) {
690     if (other.properties != null) {
691       this.properties = (Properties)other.properties.clone();
692     }
693
694     if (other.overlay!=null) {
695       this.overlay = (Properties)other.overlay.clone();
696     }
697
698     this.updatingResource = new HashMap<String, String[]>(other.updatingResource);
699   }
700   
701    this.finalParameters = new HashSet<String>(other.finalParameters);
702    synchronized(Configuration.class) {
703      REGISTRY.put(this, null);
704    }
705    this.classLoader = other.classLoader;
706    this.loadDefaults = other.loadDefaults;
707    setQuietMode(other.getQuietMode());
708  }

710  /**
711   * Add a default resource. Resources are loaded in the order of the resources 
712   * added.
713   * @param name file name. File should be present in the classpath.
714   */
715  public static synchronized void addDefaultResource(String name) {
716    if(!defaultResources.contains(name)) {
717      defaultResources.add(name);
718      for(Configuration conf : REGISTRY.keySet()) {
719        if(conf.loadDefaults) {
720          conf.reloadConfiguration();
721        }
722      }
723    }
724  }

799  /**
800   * Reload configuration from previously added resources.
801   *
802   * This method will clear all the configuration read from the added 
803   * resources, and final parameters. This will make the resources to 
804   * be read again before accessing the values. Values that are added
805   * via set methods will overlay values read from the resources.
806   */
807  public synchronized void reloadConfiguration() {
808    properties = null;                            // trigger reload
809    finalParameters.clear();                      // clear site-limits
810  }

812  private synchronized void addResourceObject(Resource resource) {
813    resources.add(resource);                      // add to resources
814    reloadConfiguration();
815  }

817  private static Pattern varPat = Pattern.compile("\\$\\{[^\\}\\$\u0020]+\\}");
818  private static int MAX_SUBST = 20;
819
820  private String substituteVars(String expr) {
821    if (expr == null) {
822      return null;
823    }
824    Matcher match = varPat.matcher("");
825    String eval = expr;
826    for(int s=0; s<MAX_SUBST; s++) {
827      match.reset(eval);
828      if (!match.find()) {
829        return eval;
830      }
831      String var = match.group();
832      var = var.substring(2, var.length()-1); // remove ${ .. }
833      String val = null;
834      try {
835        val = System.getProperty(var);
836      } catch(SecurityException se) {
837        LOG.warn("Unexpected SecurityException in Configuration", se);
838      }
839      if (val == null) {
840        val = getRaw(var);
841      }
842      if (val == null) {
843        return eval; // return literal ${var}: var is unbound
844      }
845      // substitute
846      eval = eval.substring(0, match.start())+val+eval.substring(match.end());
847    }
848    throw new IllegalStateException("Variable substitution depth too large: " 
849                                    + MAX_SUBST + " " + expr);
850  }

852  /**
853   * Get the value of the <code>name</code> property, <code>null</code> if
854   * no such property exists. If the key is deprecated, it returns the value of
855   * the first key which replaces the deprecated key and is not null
856   * 
857   * Values are processed for <a href="#VariableExpansion">variable expansion</a> 
858   * before being returned. 
859   * 
860   * @param name the property name.
861   * @return the value of the <code>name</code> or its replacing property, 
862   *         or null if no such property exists.
863   */
864  public String get(String name) {
865    String[] names = handleDeprecation(deprecationContext.get(), name);
866    String result = null;
867    for(String n : names) {
868      result = substituteVars(getProps().getProperty(n));
869    }
870    return result;
871  }

873  /**
874   * Get the value of the <code>name</code> property as a trimmed <code>String</code>, 
875   * <code>null</code> if no such property exists. 
876   * If the key is deprecated, it returns the value of
877   * the first key which replaces the deprecated key and is not null
878   * 
879   * Values are processed for <a href="#VariableExpansion">variable expansion</a> 
880   * before being returned. 
881   * 
882   * @param name the property name.
883   * @return the value of the <code>name</code> or its replacing property, 
884   *         or null if no such property exists.
885   */
886  public String getTrimmed(String name) {
887    String value = get(name);
888    
889    if (null == value) {
890      return null;
891    } else {
892      return value.trim();
893    }
894  }

931   * Set the <code>value</code> of the <code>name</code> property. If 
932   * <code>name</code> is deprecated or there is a deprecated name associated to it,
933   * it sets the value to both names.
934   * 
935   * @param name property name.
936   * @param value property value.
937   */
938  public void set(String name, String value) {
939    set(name, value, null);
940  }

942  /** 
943   * Set the <code>value</code> of the <code>name</code> property. If 
944   * <code>name</code> is deprecated or there is a deprecated name associated to it,
945   * it sets the value to both names.
946   * 
947   * @param name property name.
948   * @param value property value.
949   * @param source the place that this configuration value came from 
950   * (For debugging).
951   * @throws IllegalArgumentException when the value or name is null.
952   */
953  public void set(String name, String value, String source) {
954    Preconditions.checkArgument(
955        name != null,
956        "Property name must not be null");
957    Preconditions.checkArgument(
958        value != null,
959        "Property value must not be null");
960    DeprecationContext deprecations = deprecationContext.get();
961    if (deprecations.getDeprecatedKeyMap().isEmpty()) {
962      getProps();
963    }
964    getOverlay().setProperty(name, value);
965    getProps().setProperty(name, value);
966    if(source == null) {
967      updatingResource.put(name, new String[] {"programatically"});
968    } else {
969      updatingResource.put(name, new String[] {source});
970    }
971    String[] altNames = getAlternateNames(name);
972    if (altNames != null && altNames.length > 0) {
973      String altSource = "because " + name + " is deprecated";
974      for(String altName : altNames) {
975        if(!altName.equals(name)) {
976          getOverlay().setProperty(altName, value);
977          getProps().setProperty(altName, value);
978          updatingResource.put(altName, new String[] {altSource});
979        }
980      }
981    }
982    warnOnceIfDeprecated(deprecations, name);
983  }
984
985  private void warnOnceIfDeprecated(DeprecationContext deprecations, String name) {
986    DeprecatedKeyInfo keyInfo = deprecations.getDeprecatedKeyMap().get(name);
987    if (keyInfo != null && !keyInfo.getAndSetAccessed()) {
988      LOG_DEPRECATION.info(keyInfo.getWarningMessage(name));
989    }
990  }
991
992  /**
993   * Unset a previously set property.
994   */
995  public synchronized void unset(String name) {
996    String[] altNames = getAlternateNames(name);
997    getOverlay().remove(name);
998    getProps().remove(name);
999    if (altNames !=null && altNames.length > 0) {
1000      for(String altName : altNames) {
1001        getOverlay().remove(altName);
1002        getProps().remove(altName);
1003      }
1004    }
1005  }
1006
1007  /**
1008   * Sets a property if it is currently unset.
1009   * @param name the property name
1010   * @param value the new value
1011   */
1012  public synchronized void setIfUnset(String name, String value) {
1013    if (get(name) == null) {
1014      set(name, value);
1015    }
1016  }

1046  /** 
1047   * Get the value of the <code>name</code> property as an <code>int</code>.
1048   *   
1049   * If no such property exists, the provided default value is returned,
1050   * or if the specified value is not a valid <code>int</code>,
1051   * then an error is thrown.
1052   * 
1053   * @param name property name.
1054   * @param defaultValue default value.
1055   * @throws NumberFormatException when the value is invalid
1056   * @return property value as an <code>int</code>, 
1057   *         or <code>defaultValue</code>. 
1058   */
1059  public int getInt(String name, int defaultValue) {
1060    String valueString = getTrimmed(name);
1061    if (valueString == null)
1062      return defaultValue;
1063    String hexString = getHexDigits(valueString);
1064    if (hexString != null) {
1065      return Integer.parseInt(hexString, 16);
1066    }
1067    return Integer.parseInt(valueString);
1068  }

1070  /**
1071   * Get the value of the <code>name</code> property as a set of comma-delimited
1072   * <code>int</code> values.
1073   * 
1074   * If no such property exists, an empty array is returned.
1075   * 
1076   * @param name property name
1077   * @return property value interpreted as an array of comma-delimited
1078   *         <code>int</code> values
1079   */
1080  public int[] getInts(String name) {
1081    String[] strings = getTrimmedStrings(name);
1082    int[] ints = new int[strings.length];
1083    for (int i = 0; i < strings.length; i++) {
1084      ints[i] = Integer.parseInt(strings[i]);
1085    }
1086    return ints;
1087  }

1123  /**
1124   * Get the value of the <code>name</code> property as a <code>long</code> or
1125   * human readable format. If no such property exists, the provided default
1126   * value is returned, or if the specified value is not a valid
1127   * <code>long</code> or human readable format, then an error is thrown. You
1128   * can use the following suffix (case insensitive): k(kilo), m(mega), g(giga),
1129   * t(tera), p(peta), e(exa)
1130   *
1131   * @param name property name.
1132   * @param defaultValue default value.
1133   * @throws NumberFormatException when the value is invalid
1134   * @return property value as a <code>long</code>,
1135   *         or <code>defaultValue</code>.
1136   */
1137  public long getLongBytes(String name, long defaultValue) {
1138    String valueString = getTrimmed(name);
1139    if (valueString == null)
1140      return defaultValue;
1141    return StringUtils.TraditionalBinaryPrefix.string2long(valueString);
1142  }

1144  private String getHexDigits(String value) {
1145    boolean negative = false;
1146    String str = value;
1147    String hexString = null;
1148    if (value.startsWith("-")) {
1149      negative = true;
1150      str = value.substring(1);
1151    }
1152    if (str.startsWith("0x") || str.startsWith("0X")) {
1153      hexString = str.substring(2);
1154      if (negative) {
1155        hexString = "-" + hexString;
1156      }
1157      return hexString;
1158    }
1159    return null;
1160  }

1230  /** 
1231   * Get the value of the <code>name</code> property as a <code>boolean</code>.  
1232   * If no such property is specified, or if the specified value is not a valid
1233   * <code>boolean</code>, then <code>defaultValue</code> is returned.
1234   * 
1235   * @param name property name.
1236   * @param defaultValue default value.
1237   * @return property value as a <code>boolean</code>, 
1238   *         or <code>defaultValue</code>. 
1239   */
1240  public boolean getBoolean(String name, boolean defaultValue) {
1241    String valueString = getTrimmed(name);
1242    if (null == valueString || valueString.isEmpty()) {
1243      return defaultValue;
1244    }
1245
1246    valueString = valueString.toLowerCase();
1247
1248    if ("true".equals(valueString))
1249      return true;
1250    else if ("false".equals(valueString))
1251      return false;
1252    else return defaultValue;
1253  }

1284  /**
1285   * Return value matching this enumerated type.
1286   * @param name Property name
1287   * @param defaultValue Value returned if no mapping exists
1288   * @throws IllegalArgumentException If mapping is illegal for the type
1289   * provided
1290   */

1293    return null == val
1294      ? defaultValue
1295      : Enum.valueOf(defaultValue.getDeclaringClass(), val);

1298  enum ParsedTimeDuration {
1299    NS {
1300      TimeUnit unit() { return TimeUnit.NANOSECONDS; }
1301      String suffix() { return "ns"; }
1302    },
1303    US {
1304      TimeUnit unit() { return TimeUnit.MICROSECONDS; }
1305      String suffix() { return "us"; }
1306    },
1307    MS {
1308      TimeUnit unit() { return TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS; }
1309      String suffix() { return "ms"; }
1310    },
1311    S {
1312      TimeUnit unit() { return TimeUnit.SECONDS; }
1313      String suffix() { return "s"; }
1314    },
1315    M {
1316      TimeUnit unit() { return TimeUnit.MINUTES; }
1317      String suffix() { return "m"; }
1318    },
1319    H {
1320      TimeUnit unit() { return TimeUnit.HOURS; }
1321      String suffix() { return "h"; }
1322    },
1323    D {
1324      TimeUnit unit() { return TimeUnit.DAYS; }
1325      String suffix() { return "d"; }
1326    };
1327    abstract TimeUnit unit();
1328    abstract String suffix();
1329    static ParsedTimeDuration unitFor(String s) {
1330      for (ParsedTimeDuration ptd : values()) {
1331        // iteration order is in decl order, so SECONDS matched last
1332        if (s.endsWith(ptd.suffix())) {
1333          return ptd;
1334        }
1335      }
1336      return null;
1337    }
1338    static ParsedTimeDuration unitFor(TimeUnit unit) {
1339      for (ParsedTimeDuration ptd : values()) {
1340        if (ptd.unit() == unit) {
1341          return ptd;
1342        }
1343      }
1344      return null;
1345    }
1346  }
1347
1348  /**
1349   * Set the value of <code>name</code> to the given time duration. This
1350   * is equivalent to <code>set(&lt;name&gt;, value + &lt;time suffix&gt;)</code>.
1351   * @param name Property name
1352   * @param value Time duration
1353   * @param unit Unit of time
1354   */
1355  public void setTimeDuration(String name, long value, TimeUnit unit) {
1356    set(name, value + ParsedTimeDuration.unitFor(unit).suffix());
1357  }

1359  /**
1360   * Return time duration in the given time unit. Valid units are encoded in
1361   * properties as suffixes: nanoseconds (ns), microseconds (us), milliseconds
1362   * (ms), seconds (s), minutes (m), hours (h), and days (d).
1363   * @param name Property name
1364   * @param defaultValue Value returned if no mapping exists.
1365   * @param unit Unit to convert the stored property, if it exists.
1366   * @throws NumberFormatException If the property stripped of its unit is not
1367   *         a number
1368   */
1369  public long getTimeDuration(String name, long defaultValue, TimeUnit unit) {
1370    String vStr = get(name);
1371    if (null == vStr) {
1372      return defaultValue;
1373    }
1374    vStr = vStr.trim();
1375    ParsedTimeDuration vUnit = ParsedTimeDuration.unitFor(vStr);
1376    if (null == vUnit) {
1377      LOG.warn("No unit for " + name + "(" + vStr + ") assuming " + unit);
1378      vUnit = ParsedTimeDuration.unitFor(unit);
1379    } else {
1380      vStr = vStr.substring(0, vStr.lastIndexOf(vUnit.suffix()));
1381    }
1382    return unit.convert(Long.parseLong(vStr), vUnit.unit());
1383  }

1385  /**
1386   * Get the value of the <code>name</code> property as a <code>Pattern</code>.
1387   * If no such property is specified, or if the specified value is not a valid
1388   * <code>Pattern</code>, then <code>DefaultValue</code> is returned.
1389   *
1390   * @param name property name
1391   * @param defaultValue default value
1392   * @return property value as a compiled Pattern, or defaultValue
1393   */
1394  public Pattern getPattern(String name, Pattern defaultValue) {
1395    String valString = get(name);
1396    if (null == valString || valString.isEmpty()) {
1397      return defaultValue;
1398    }
1399    try {
1400      return Pattern.compile(valString);
1401    } catch (PatternSyntaxException pse) {
1402      LOG.warn("Regular expression '" + valString + "' for property '" +
1403               name + "' not valid. Using default", pse);
1404      return defaultValue;
1405    }
1406  }

1424  /**
1425   * Gets information about why a property was set.  Typically this is the 
1426   * path to the resource objects (file, URL, etc.) the property came from, but
1427   * it can also indicate that it was set programatically, or because of the
1428   * command line.
1429   *
1430   * @param name - The property name to get the source of.
1431   * @return null - If the property or its source wasn't found. Otherwise, 
1432   * returns a list of the sources of the resource.  The older sources are
1433   * the first ones in the list.  So for example if a configuration is set from
1434   * the command line, and then written out to a file that is read back in the
1435   * first entry would indicate that it was set from the command line, while
1436   * the second one would indicate the file that the new configuration was read
1437   * in from.
1438   */
1439  @InterfaceStability.Unstable
1440  public synchronized String[] getPropertySources(String name) {
1441    if (properties == null) {
1442      // If properties is null, it means a resource was newly added
1443      // but the props were cleared so as to load it upon future
1444      // requests. So lets force a load by asking a properties list.
1445      getProps();
1446    }
1447    // Return a null right away if our properties still
1448    // haven't loaded or the resource mapping isn't defined
1449    if (properties == null || updatingResource == null) {
1450      return null;
1451    } else {
1452      String[] source = updatingResource.get(name);
1453      if(source == null) {
1454        return null;
1455      } else {
1456        return Arrays.copyOf(source, source.length);
1457      }
1458    }
1459  }

1461  /**
1462   * A class that represents a set of positive integer ranges. It parses 
1463   * strings of the form: "2-3,5,7-" where ranges are separated by comma and 
1464   * the lower/upper bounds are separated by dash. Either the lower or upper 
1465   * bound may be omitted meaning all values up to or over. So the string 
1466   * above means 2, 3, 5, and 7, 8, 9, ...
1467   */
1468  public static class IntegerRanges implements Iterable<Integer>{
1469    private static class Range {
1470      int start;
1471      int end;
1472    }
1473    
1474    private static class RangeNumberIterator implements Iterator<Integer> {
1475      Iterator<Range> internal;
1476      int at;
1477      int end;
1478
1479      public RangeNumberIterator(List<Range> ranges) {
1480        if (ranges != null) {
1481          internal = ranges.iterator();
1482        }
1483        at = -1;
1484        end = -2;
1485      }
1486      
1487      @Override
1488      public boolean hasNext() {
1489        if (at <= end) {
1490          return true;
1491        } else if (internal != null){
1492          return internal.hasNext();
1493        }
1494        return false;
1495      }
1496
1497      @Override
1498      public Integer next() {
1499        if (at <= end) {
1500          at++;
1501          return at - 1;
1502        } else if (internal != null){
1503          Range found = internal.next();
1504          if (found != null) {
1505            at = found.start;
1506            end = found.end;
1507            at++;
1508            return at - 1;
1509          }
1510        }
1511        return null;
1512      }
1513
1514      @Override
1515      public void remove() {
1516        throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
1517      }
1518    };
1519
1520    List<Range> ranges = new ArrayList<Range>();
1521    
1522    public IntegerRanges() {
1523    }
1524    
1525    public IntegerRanges(String newValue) {
1526      StringTokenizer itr = new StringTokenizer(newValue, ",");
1527      while (itr.hasMoreTokens()) {
1528        String rng = itr.nextToken().trim();
1529        String[] parts = rng.split("-", 3);
1530        if (parts.length < 1 || parts.length > 2) {
1531          throw new IllegalArgumentException("integer range badly formed: " + 
1532                                             rng);
1533        }
1534        Range r = new Range();
1535        r.start = convertToInt(parts[0], 0);
1536        if (parts.length == 2) {
1537          r.end = convertToInt(parts[1], Integer.MAX_VALUE);
1538        } else {
1539          r.end = r.start;
1540        }
1541        if (r.start > r.end) {
1542          throw new IllegalArgumentException("IntegerRange from " + r.start + 
1543                                             " to " + r.end + " is invalid");
1544        }
1545        ranges.add(r);
1546      }
1547    }
1548
1549    /**
1550     * Convert a string to an int treating empty strings as the default value.
1551     * @param value the string value
1552     * @param defaultValue the value for if the string is empty
1553     * @return the desired integer
1554     */
1555    private static int convertToInt(String value, int defaultValue) {
1556      String trim = value.trim();
1557      if (trim.length() == 0) {
1558        return defaultValue;
1559      }
1560      return Integer.parseInt(trim);
1561    }
1562
1563    /**
1564     * Is the given value in the set of ranges
1565     * @param value the value to check
1566     * @return is the value in the ranges?
1567     */
1568    public boolean isIncluded(int value) {
1569      for(Range r: ranges) {
1570        if (r.start <= value && value <= r.end) {
1571          return true;
1572        }
1573      }
1574      return false;
1575    }
1576    
1577    /**
1578     * @return true if there are no values in this range, else false.
1579     */
1580    public boolean isEmpty() {
1581      return ranges == null || ranges.isEmpty();
1582    }
1583    
1584    @Override
1585    public String toString() {
1586      StringBuilder result = new StringBuilder();
1587      boolean first = true;
1588      for(Range r: ranges) {
1589        if (first) {
1590          first = false;
1591        } else {
1592          result.append(',');
1593        }
1594        result.append(r.start);
1595        result.append('-');
1596        result.append(r.end);
1597      }
1598      return result.toString();
1599    }
1600
1601    @Override
1602    public Iterator<Integer> iterator() {
1603      return new RangeNumberIterator(ranges);
1604    }
1605    
1606  }

1614  public IntegerRanges getRange(String name, String defaultValue) {

1764  /**
1765   * Load a class by name.
1766   * 
1767   * @param name the class name.
1768   * @return the class object.
1769   * @throws ClassNotFoundException if the class is not found.
1770   */
1771  public Class<?> getClassByName(String name) throws ClassNotFoundException {
1772    Class<?> ret = getClassByNameOrNull(name);
1773    if (ret == null) {
1774      throw new ClassNotFoundException("Class " + name + " not found");
1775    }
1776    return ret;
1777  }
1778  
1779  /**
1780   * Load a class by name, returning null rather than throwing an exception
1781   * if it couldn't be loaded. This is to avoid the overhead of creating
1782   * an exception.
1783   * 
1784   * @param name the class name
1785   * @return the class object, or null if it could not be found.
1786   */
1787  public Class<?> getClassByNameOrNull(String name) {
1788    Map<String, WeakReference<Class<?>>> map;
1789    
1790    synchronized (CACHE_CLASSES) {
1791      map = CACHE_CLASSES.get(classLoader);
1792      if (map == null) {
1793        map = Collections.synchronizedMap(
1794          new WeakHashMap<String, WeakReference<Class<?>>>());
1795        CACHE_CLASSES.put(classLoader, map);
1796      }
1797    }
1798
1799    Class<?> clazz = null;
1800    WeakReference<Class<?>> ref = map.get(name); 
1801    if (ref != null) {
1802       clazz = ref.get();
1803    }
1804     
1805    if (clazz == null) {
1806      try {
1807        clazz = Class.forName(name, true, classLoader);
1808      } catch (ClassNotFoundException e) {
1809        // Leave a marker that the class isn't found
1810        map.put(name, new WeakReference<Class<?>>(NEGATIVE_CACHE_SENTINEL));
1811        return null;
1812      }
1813      // two putters can race here, but they'll put the same class
1814      map.put(name, new WeakReference<Class<?>>(clazz));
1815      return clazz;
1816    } else if (clazz == NEGATIVE_CACHE_SENTINEL) {
1817      return null; // not found
1818    } else {
1819      // cache hit
1820      return clazz;
1821    }
1822  }

1825   * Get the value of the <code>name</code> property
1826   * as an array of <code>Class</code>.
1827   * The value of the property specifies a list of comma separated class names.  
1828   * If no such property is specified, then <code>defaultValue</code> is 
1829   * returned.

1832   * @param defaultValue default value.
1833   * @return property value as a <code>Class[]</code>, 
1834   *         or <code>defaultValue</code>. 
1835   */
1836  public Class<?>[] getClasses(String name, Class<?> ... defaultValue) {
1837    String[] classnames = getTrimmedStrings(name);
1838    if (classnames == null)
1839      return defaultValue;
1840    try {
1841      Class<?>[] classes = new Class<?>[classnames.length];
1842      for(int i = 0; i < classnames.length; i++) {
1843        classes[i] = getClassByName(classnames[i]);
1844      }
1845      return classes;
1846    } catch (ClassNotFoundException e) {
1847      throw new RuntimeException(e);
1848    }
1849  }

1859   *         or <code>defaultValue</code>.

1864      return defaultValue;

1872  /** 
1873   * Get the value of the <code>name</code> property as a <code>Class</code>
1874   * implementing the interface specified by <code>xface</code>.
1875   *   
1876   * If no such property is specified, then <code>defaultValue</code> is 
1877   * returned.
1878   * 
1879   * An exception is thrown if the returned class does not implement the named
1880   * interface. 
1881   * 
1882   * @param name the class name.
1883   * @param defaultValue default value.
1884   * @param xface the interface implemented by the named class.
1885   * @return property value as a <code>Class</code>, 
1886   *         or <code>defaultValue</code>.
1887   */
1888  public <U> Class<? extends U> getClass(String name, 
1889                                         Class<? extends U> defaultValue, 
1890                                         Class<U> xface) {
1891    try {
1892      Class<?> theClass = getClass(name, defaultValue);
1893      if (theClass != null && !xface.isAssignableFrom(theClass))
1894        throw new RuntimeException(theClass+" not "+xface.getName());
1895      else if (theClass != null)
1896        return theClass.asSubclass(xface);
1897      else
1898        return null;
1899    } catch (Exception e) {
1900      throw new RuntimeException(e);
1901    }
1902  }

1904  /**
1905   * Get the value of the <code>name</code> property as a <code>List</code>
1906   * of objects implementing the interface specified by <code>xface</code>.
1907   * 
1908   * An exception is thrown if any of the classes does not exist, or if it does
1909   * not implement the named interface.
1910   * 
1911   * @param name the property name.
1912   * @param xface the interface implemented by the classes named by
1913   *        <code>name</code>.
1914   * @return a <code>List</code> of objects implementing <code>xface</code>.
1915   */
1916  @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
1917  public <U> List<U> getInstances(String name, Class<U> xface) {
1918    List<U> ret = new ArrayList<U>();
1919    Class<?>[] classes = getClasses(name);
1920    for (Class<?> cl: classes) {
1921      if (!xface.isAssignableFrom(cl)) {
1922        throw new RuntimeException(cl + " does not implement " + xface);
1923      }
1924      ret.add((U)ReflectionUtils.newInstance(cl, this));
1925    }
1926    return ret;
1927  }

1946  /** 
1947   * Get a local file under a directory named by <i>dirsProp</i> with
1948   * the given <i>path</i>.  If <i>dirsProp</i> contains multiple directories,
1949   * then one is chosen based on <i>path</i>'s hash code.  If the selected
1950   * directory does not exist, an attempt is made to create it.
1951   * 
1952   * @param dirsProp directory in which to locate the file.
1953   * @param path file-path.
1954   * @return local file under the directory with the given path.
1955   */
1956  public Path getLocalPath(String dirsProp, String path)
1957    throws IOException {
1958    String[] dirs = getTrimmedStrings(dirsProp);
1959    int hashCode = path.hashCode();
1960    FileSystem fs = FileSystem.getLocal(this);
1961    for (int i = 0; i < dirs.length; i++) {  // try each local dir
1962      int index = (hashCode+i & Integer.MAX_VALUE) % dirs.length;
1963      Path file = new Path(dirs[index], path);
1964      Path dir = file.getParent();
1965      if (fs.mkdirs(dir) || fs.exists(dir)) {
1966        return file;
1967      }
1968    }
1969    LOG.warn("Could not make " + path + 
1970             " in local directories from " + dirsProp);
1971    for(int i=0; i < dirs.length; i++) {
1972      int index = (hashCode+i & Integer.MAX_VALUE) % dirs.length;
1973      LOG.warn(dirsProp + "[" + index + "]=" + dirs[index]);
1974    }
1975    throw new IOException("No valid local directories in property: "+dirsProp);
1976  }
1977
1978  /** 
1979   * Get a local file name under a directory named in <i>dirsProp</i> with
1980   * the given <i>path</i>.  If <i>dirsProp</i> contains multiple directories,
1981   * then one is chosen based on <i>path</i>'s hash code.  If the selected
1982   * directory does not exist, an attempt is made to create it.
1983   * 
1984   * @param dirsProp directory in which to locate the file.
1985   * @param path file-path.
1986   * @return local file under the directory with the given path.
1987   */
1988  public File getFile(String dirsProp, String path)
1989    throws IOException {
1990    String[] dirs = getTrimmedStrings(dirsProp);
1991    int hashCode = path.hashCode();
1992    for (int i = 0; i < dirs.length; i++) {  // try each local dir
1993      int index = (hashCode+i & Integer.MAX_VALUE) % dirs.length;
1994      File file = new File(dirs[index], path);
1995      File dir = file.getParentFile();
1996      if (dir.exists() || dir.mkdirs()) {
1997        return file;
1998      }
1999    }
2000    throw new IOException("No valid local directories in property: "+dirsProp);
2001  }

2013  /** 
2014   * Get an input stream attached to the configuration resource with the
2015   * given <code>name</code>.
2016   * 
2017   * @param name configuration resource name.
2018   * @return an input stream attached to the resource.
2019   */
2020  public InputStream getConfResourceAsInputStream(String name) {
2021    try {
2022      URL url= getResource(name);
2023
2024      if (url == null) {
2025        LOG.info(name + " not found");
2026        return null;
2027      } else {
2028        LOG.info("found resource " + name + " at " + url);
2029      }
2030
2031      return url.openStream();
2032    } catch (Exception e) {
2033      return null;
2034    }
2035  }

2061  protected synchronized Properties getProps() {
2062    if (properties == null) {
2063      properties = new Properties();
2064      HashMap<String, String[]> backup = 
2065        new HashMap<String, String[]>(updatingResource);
2066      loadResources(properties, resources, quietmode);
2067      if (overlay!= null) {
2068        properties.putAll(overlay);
2069        for (Map.Entry<Object,Object> item: overlay.entrySet()) {
2070          String key = (String)item.getKey();
2071          updatingResource.put(key, backup.get(key));
2072        }
2073      }
2074    }
2075    return properties;
2076  }

2095  /**
2096   * Get an {@link Iterator} to go through the list of <code>String</code> 
2097   * key-value pairs in the configuration.
2098   * 
2099   * @return an iterator over the entries.
2100   */
2101  @Override
2102  public Iterator<Map.Entry<String, String>> iterator() {
2103    // Get a copy of just the string to string pairs. After the old object
2104    // methods that allow non-strings to be put into configurations are removed,
2105    // we could replace properties with a Map<String,String> and get rid of this
2106    // code.
2107    Map<String,String> result = new HashMap<String,String>();
2108    for(Map.Entry<Object,Object> item: getProps().entrySet()) {
2109      if (item.getKey() instanceof String && 
2110          item.getValue() instanceof String) {
2111        result.put((String) item.getKey(), (String) item.getValue());
2112      }
2113    }
2114    return result.entrySet().iterator();
2115  }

2117  private Document parse(DocumentBuilder builder, URL url)
2118      throws IOException, SAXException {
2119    if (!quietmode) {
2120      LOG.info("parsing URL " + url);
2121    }
2122    if (url == null) {
2123      return null;
2124    }
2125    return parse(builder, url.openStream(), url.toString());
2126  }
2127
2128  private Document parse(DocumentBuilder builder, InputStream is,
2129      String systemId) throws IOException, SAXException {
2130    if (!quietmode) {
2131      LOG.info("parsing input stream " + is);
2132    }
2133    if (is == null) {
2134      return null;
2135    }
2136    try {
2137      return (systemId == null) ? builder.parse(is) : builder.parse(is,
2138          systemId);
2139    } finally {
2140      is.close();
2141    }
2142  }
2143
2144  private void loadResources(Properties properties,
2145                             ArrayList<Resource> resources,
2146                             boolean quiet) {
2147    if(loadDefaults) {
2148      for (String resource : defaultResources) {
2149        loadResource(properties, new Resource(resource), quiet);
2150      }
2151    
2152      //support the hadoop-site.xml as a deprecated case
2153      if(getResource("hadoop-site.xml")!=null) {
2154        loadResource(properties, new Resource("hadoop-site.xml"), quiet);
2155      }
2156    }
2157    
2158    for (int i = 0; i < resources.size(); i++) {
2159      Resource ret = loadResource(properties, resources.get(i), quiet);
2160      if (ret != null) {
2161        resources.set(i, ret);
2162      }
2163    }
2164  }
2165  
2166  private Resource loadResource(Properties properties, Resource wrapper, boolean quiet) {
2167    String name = UNKNOWN_RESOURCE;
2168    try {
2169      Object resource = wrapper.getResource();
2170      name = wrapper.getName();
2171      
2172      DocumentBuilderFactory docBuilderFactory 
2173        = DocumentBuilderFactory.newInstance();
2174      //ignore all comments inside the xml file
2175      docBuilderFactory.setIgnoringComments(true);
2176
2177      //allow includes in the xml file
2178      docBuilderFactory.setNamespaceAware(true);
2179      try {
2180          docBuilderFactory.setXIncludeAware(true);
2181      } catch (UnsupportedOperationException e) {
2182        LOG.error("Failed to set setXIncludeAware(true) for parser "
2183                + docBuilderFactory
2184                + ":" + e,
2185                e);
2186      }
2187      DocumentBuilder builder = docBuilderFactory.newDocumentBuilder();
2188      Document doc = null;
2189      Element root = null;
2190      boolean returnCachedProperties = false;
2191      
2192      if (resource instanceof URL) {                  // an URL resource
2193        doc = parse(builder, (URL)resource);
2194      } else if (resource instanceof String) {        // a CLASSPATH resource
2195        URL url = getResource((String)resource);
2196        doc = parse(builder, url);
2197      } else if (resource instanceof Path) {          // a file resource
2198        // Can't use FileSystem API or we get an infinite loop
2199        // since FileSystem uses Configuration API.  Use java.io.File instead.
2200        File file = new File(((Path)resource).toUri().getPath())
2201          .getAbsoluteFile();
2202        if (file.exists()) {
2203          if (!quiet) {
2204            LOG.info("parsing File " + file);
2205          }
2206          doc = parse(builder, new BufferedInputStream(
2207              new FileInputStream(file)), ((Path)resource).toString());
2208        }
2209      } else if (resource instanceof InputStream) {
2210        doc = parse(builder, (InputStream) resource, null);
2211        returnCachedProperties = true;
2212      } else if (resource instanceof Properties) {
2213        overlay(properties, (Properties)resource);
2214      } else if (resource instanceof Element) {
2215        root = (Element)resource;
2216      }
2217
2218      if (doc == null && root == null) {
2219        if (quiet)
2220          return null;
2221        throw new RuntimeException(resource + " not found");
2222      }
2223
2224      if (root == null) {
2225        root = doc.getDocumentElement();
2226      }
2227      Properties toAddTo = properties;
2228      if(returnCachedProperties) {
2229        toAddTo = new Properties();
2230      }
2231      if (!"configuration".equals(root.getTagName()))
2232        LOG.fatal("bad conf file: top-level element not <configuration>");
2233      NodeList props = root.getChildNodes();
2234      DeprecationContext deprecations = deprecationContext.get();
2235      for (int i = 0; i < props.getLength(); i++) {
2236        Node propNode = props.item(i);
2237        if (!(propNode instanceof Element))
2238          continue;
2239        Element prop = (Element)propNode;
2240        if ("configuration".equals(prop.getTagName())) {
2241          loadResource(toAddTo, new Resource(prop, name), quiet);
2242          continue;
2243        }
2244        if (!"property".equals(prop.getTagName()))
2245          LOG.warn("bad conf file: element not <property>");
2246        NodeList fields = prop.getChildNodes();
2247        String attr = null;
2248        String value = null;
2249        boolean finalParameter = false;
2250        LinkedList<String> source = new LinkedList<String>();
2251        for (int j = 0; j < fields.getLength(); j++) {
2252          Node fieldNode = fields.item(j);
2253          if (!(fieldNode instanceof Element))
2254            continue;
2255          Element field = (Element)fieldNode;
2256          if ("name".equals(field.getTagName()) && field.hasChildNodes())
2257            attr = StringInterner.weakIntern(
2258                ((Text)field.getFirstChild()).getData().trim());
2259          if ("value".equals(field.getTagName()) && field.hasChildNodes())
2260            value = StringInterner.weakIntern(
2261                ((Text)field.getFirstChild()).getData());
2262          if ("final".equals(field.getTagName()) && field.hasChildNodes())
2263            finalParameter = "true".equals(((Text)field.getFirstChild()).getData());
2264          if ("source".equals(field.getTagName()) && field.hasChildNodes())
2265            source.add(StringInterner.weakIntern(
2266                ((Text)field.getFirstChild()).getData()));
2267        }
2268        source.add(name);
2269        
2270        // Ignore this parameter if it has already been marked as 'final'
2271        if (attr != null) {
2272          if (deprecations.getDeprecatedKeyMap().containsKey(attr)) {
2273            DeprecatedKeyInfo keyInfo =
2274                deprecations.getDeprecatedKeyMap().get(attr);
2275            keyInfo.clearAccessed();
2276            for (String key:keyInfo.newKeys) {
2277              // update new keys with deprecated key's value 
2278              loadProperty(toAddTo, name, key, value, finalParameter, 
2279                  source.toArray(new String[source.size()]));
2280            }
2281          }
2282          else {
2283            loadProperty(toAddTo, name, attr, value, finalParameter, 
2284                source.toArray(new String[source.size()]));
2285          }
2286        }
2287      }
2288      
2289      if (returnCachedProperties) {
2290        overlay(properties, toAddTo);
2291        return new Resource(toAddTo, name);
2292      }
2293      return null;
2294    } catch (IOException e) {
2295      LOG.fatal("error parsing conf " + name, e);
2296      throw new RuntimeException(e);
2297    } catch (DOMException e) {
2298      LOG.fatal("error parsing conf " + name, e);
2299      throw new RuntimeException(e);
2300    } catch (SAXException e) {
2301      LOG.fatal("error parsing conf " + name, e);
2302      throw new RuntimeException(e);
2303    } catch (ParserConfigurationException e) {
2304      LOG.fatal("error parsing conf " + name , e);
2305      throw new RuntimeException(e);
2306    }
2307  }
2308
2309  private void overlay(Properties to, Properties from) {
2310    for (Entry<Object, Object> entry: from.entrySet()) {
2311      to.put(entry.getKey(), entry.getValue());
2312    }
2313  }
2314  
2315  private void loadProperty(Properties properties, String name, String attr,
2316      String value, boolean finalParameter, String[] source) {
2317    if (value != null) {
2318      if (!finalParameters.contains(attr)) {
2319        properties.setProperty(attr, value);
2320        updatingResource.put(attr, source);
2321      } else {
2322        LOG.warn(name+":an attempt to override final parameter: "+attr
2323            +";  Ignoring.");
2324      }
2325    }
2326    if (finalParameter) {
2327      finalParameters.add(attr);
2328    }
2329  }

2333   * {@link OutputStream} using UTF-8 encoding.
2334   * 
2335   * @param out the output stream to write to.
2336   */

2338    writeXml(new OutputStreamWriter(out, "UTF-8"));
2339  }

2341  /** 
2342   * Write out the non-default properties in this configuration to the given
2343   * {@link Writer}.
2344   * 
2345   * @param out the writer to write to.
2346   */
2347  public void writeXml(Writer out) throws IOException {
2348    Document doc = asXmlDocument();
2349
2350    try {
2351      DOMSource source = new DOMSource(doc);
2352      StreamResult result = new StreamResult(out);
2353      TransformerFactory transFactory = TransformerFactory.newInstance();
2354      Transformer transformer = transFactory.newTransformer();
2355
2356      // Important to not hold Configuration log while writing result, since
2357      // 'out' may be an HDFS stream which needs to lock this configuration
2358      // from another thread.
2359      transformer.transform(source, result);
2360    } catch (TransformerException te) {
2361      throw new IOException(te);
2362    }
2363  }
2364
2365  /**
2366   * Return the XML DOM corresponding to this Configuration.
2367   */
2368  private synchronized Document asXmlDocument() throws IOException {
2369    Document doc;
2370    try {
2371      doc =
2372        DocumentBuilderFactory.newInstance().newDocumentBuilder().newDocument();
2373    } catch (ParserConfigurationException pe) {
2374      throw new IOException(pe);
2375    }
2376    Element conf = doc.createElement("configuration");
2377    doc.appendChild(conf);
2378    conf.appendChild(doc.createTextNode("\n"));
2379    handleDeprecation(); //ensure properties is set and deprecation is handled
2380    for (Enumeration e = properties.keys(); e.hasMoreElements();) {
2381      String name = (String)e.nextElement();
2382      Object object = properties.get(name);
2383      String value = null;
2384      if (object instanceof String) {
2385        value = (String) object;
2386      }else {
2387        continue;
2388      }
2389      Element propNode = doc.createElement("property");
2390      conf.appendChild(propNode);
2391
2392      Element nameNode = doc.createElement("name");
2393      nameNode.appendChild(doc.createTextNode(name));
2394      propNode.appendChild(nameNode);
2395
2396      Element valueNode = doc.createElement("value");
2397      valueNode.appendChild(doc.createTextNode(value));
2398      propNode.appendChild(valueNode);
2399
2400      if (updatingResource != null) {
2401        String[] sources = updatingResource.get(name);
2402        if(sources != null) {
2403          for(String s : sources) {
2404            Element sourceNode = doc.createElement("source");
2405            sourceNode.appendChild(doc.createTextNode(s));
2406            propNode.appendChild(sourceNode);
2407          }
2408        }
2409      }
2410      
2411      conf.appendChild(doc.createTextNode("\n"));
2412    }
2413    return doc;
2414  }

2416  /**
2417   *  Writes out all the parameters and their properties (final and resource) to
2418   *  the given {@link Writer}
2419   *  The format of the output would be 
2420   *  { "properties" : [ {key1,value1,key1.isFinal,key1.resource}, {key2,value2,
2421   *  key2.isFinal,key2.resource}... ] } 
2422   *  It does not output the parameters of the configuration object which is 
2423   *  loaded from an input stream.
2424   * @param out the Writer to write to
2425   * @throws IOException
2426   */
2427  public static void dumpConfiguration(Configuration config,
2428      Writer out) throws IOException {
2429    JsonFactory dumpFactory = new JsonFactory();
2430    JsonGenerator dumpGenerator = dumpFactory.createJsonGenerator(out);
2431    dumpGenerator.writeStartObject();
2432    dumpGenerator.writeFieldName("properties");
2433    dumpGenerator.writeStartArray();
2434    dumpGenerator.flush();
2435    synchronized (config) {
2436      for (Map.Entry<Object,Object> item: config.getProps().entrySet()) {
2437        dumpGenerator.writeStartObject();
2438        dumpGenerator.writeStringField("key", (String) item.getKey());
2439        dumpGenerator.writeStringField("value", 
2440                                       config.get((String) item.getKey()));
2441        dumpGenerator.writeBooleanField("isFinal",
2442                                        config.finalParameters.contains(item.getKey()));
2443        String[] resources = config.updatingResource.get(item.getKey());
2444        String resource = UNKNOWN_RESOURCE;
2445        if(resources != null && resources.length > 0) {
2446          resource = resources[0];
2447        }
2448        dumpGenerator.writeStringField("resource", resource);
2449        dumpGenerator.writeEndObject();
2450      }
2451    }
2452    dumpGenerator.writeEndArray();
2453    dumpGenerator.writeEndObject();
2454    dumpGenerator.flush();
2455  }

2475  @Override
2476  public String toString() {
2477    StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();
2478    sb.append("Configuration: ");
2479    if(loadDefaults) {
2480      toString(defaultResources, sb);
2481      if(resources.size()>0) {
2482        sb.append(", ");
2483      }
2484    }
2485    toString(resources, sb);
2486    return sb.toString();
2487  }
2488  
2489  private <T> void toString(List<T> resources, StringBuilder sb) {
2490    ListIterator<T> i = resources.listIterator();
2491    while (i.hasNext()) {
2492      if (i.nextIndex() != 0) {
2493        sb.append(", ");
2494      }
2495      sb.append(i.next());
2496    }
2497  }

2520  @Override
2521  public void readFields(DataInput in) throws IOException {
2522    clear();
2523    int size = WritableUtils.readVInt(in);
2524    for(int i=0; i < size; ++i) {
2525      String key = org.apache.hadoop.io.Text.readString(in);
2526      String value = org.apache.hadoop.io.Text.readString(in);
2527      set(key, value); 
2528      String sources[] = WritableUtils.readCompressedStringArray(in);
2529      updatingResource.put(key, sources);
2530    }
2531  }
2532
2533  //@Override
2534  @Override
2535  public void write(DataOutput out) throws IOException {
2536    Properties props = getProps();
2537    WritableUtils.writeVInt(out, props.size());
2538    for(Map.Entry<Object, Object> item: props.entrySet()) {
2539      org.apache.hadoop.io.Text.writeString(out, (String) item.getKey());
2540      org.apache.hadoop.io.Text.writeString(out, (String) item.getValue());
2541      WritableUtils.writeCompressedStringArray(out, 
2542          updatingResource.get(item.getKey()));
2543    }
2544  }

2546  /**
2547   * get keys matching the the regex 
2548   * @param regex
2549   * @return Map<String,String> with matching keys
2550   */
2551  public Map<String,String> getValByRegex(String regex) {
2552    Pattern p = Pattern.compile(regex);
2553
2554    Map<String,String> result = new HashMap<String,String>();
2555    Matcher m;
2556
2557    for(Map.Entry<Object,Object> item: getProps().entrySet()) {
2558      if (item.getKey() instanceof String && 
2559          item.getValue() instanceof String) {
2560        m = p.matcher((String)item.getKey());
2561        if(m.find()) { // match
2562          result.put((String) item.getKey(), (String) item.getValue());
2563        }
2564      }
2565    }
2566    return result;
2567  }

2575  public static void dumpDeprecatedKeys() {
2576    DeprecationContext deprecations = deprecationContext.get();
2577    for (Map.Entry<String, DeprecatedKeyInfo> entry :
2578        deprecations.getDeprecatedKeyMap().entrySet()) {
2579      StringBuilder newKeys = new StringBuilder();
2580      for (String newKey : entry.getValue().newKeys) {
2581        newKeys.append(newKey).append("\t");
2582      }
2583      System.out.println(entry.getKey() + "\t" + newKeys.toString());
2584    }
2585  }
